SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.jpws.pwslib.data
Class PwsFileHeaderV3

java.lang.Object
  org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFileHeaderV3

public class PwsFileHeaderV3
extends java.lang.Object

This class represents the header fields of a PasswordSafe V3 database (persistent state) and allows to obtain objects enabling to read the remainder of the file in a decrypted fashion or to save the header to a new persistent state.

The original format definition of V3 files is available under document name: "PWS Format V3.txt" in the document folder of the developer download package.

This version of the class complies to PWS format definition 3.6. There is one additional field added as feature for JPWS: JPWS_OPTIONS_TYPE. Files created with this header will assert themselves as of this format version.

Since:
2-0-0, last modified 2-2-0
Author:
Wolfgang Keller

Constructor Detail

PwsFileHeaderV3

public PwsFileHeaderV3()
Creates an empty V3 file header. This may be used to create a new PWS file of the V3 format.

PwsFileHeaderV3

public PwsFileHeaderV3(HeaderFieldList headerFields)
Creates a V3 file header including the parameter header field list to be saved. This may be used to create a new PWS file of the V3 format.

Parameters:
headerFields - HeaderFieldList file header data-fields; may be null

PwsFileHeaderV3

public PwsFileHeaderV3(java.io.InputStream input)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       UnsupportedFileVersionException
Constructs a PWS V3 file header by reading the header data from the parameter inputstream. (This is the mandatory constructor to perform passphrase verification.)

Parameters:
input - java.io.InputStream, placed at the beginning of a PWS file
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while reading from the stream
UnsupportedFileVersionException - if the file is not a V3 file
Method Detail

setIterations

public void setIterations(int i)
Sets the number of iterations to calculate the file access validator value (hpm).

Parameters:
i - iterations (minimum 2048)

getBlockStream

public PwsBlockInputStream getBlockStream()
Returns the input block stream that is valid to read the remainder of the file (available only when reading constructor was used). The stream is positioned to the first data element after the file header.

Returns:
PwsBlockInputStream

getIterations

public int getIterations()
The actual number of iterations set to calculate the file access validator value (hpm).

getHashSeed

public byte[] getHashSeed()
A random seed value used for calculating a checksum over the file's data. (For files-to-be-written only available after save() operation.)

getReadChecksum

public byte[] getReadChecksum()
Returns the hash function verification code actually encountered at the end of a read-in persistent state of a file. This code serves to verify integrity of user data and is possibly available after EOF of the input blockstream (returned by verifyPass()) has been reached; it may, however, not be available at all.

Returns:
byte[] hmac of length 32 or null if this information is unavailable

getFileID

public UUID getFileID()
Returns the UUID identifier of the PWS file if it is available. (Note that for files-to-be-read this value is only available after a call to verifyPass() has returned successfull.)

Returns:
file UUID or null if this information is not available

getHeaderFields

public HeaderFieldList getHeaderFields()
Returns a rawfield list containing all available file header fields currently assigned to the PWS file. (Content from a persistent state (read-in) is only available after verifyPass().) The returned instance may be used to effectively alter list content.

Returns:
HeaderFieldList

setHeaderField

public void setHeaderField(PwsRawField field)
Sets the content of a header field. If the field was already present, the previous content is replaced; otherwise a new field is inserted to the header field list. Note: field type 255 is not permitted for a header field.

Parameters:
field - PwsRawField the new field or field content

getHeaderField

public PwsRawField getHeaderField(int type)
Returns the specified header field or null if unavailable.

removeHeaderField

public PwsRawField removeHeaderField(int type)
Removes the header field of the given type and returns this field if it was present.

Parameters:
type - header field type (0..254)
Returns:
PwsRawField or null
Since:
2-1-0

save

public PwsCipher save(java.io.OutputStream output,
                      PwsPassphrase passphrase)
               throws java.io.IOException
Writes the V3 PWS file header part to the given output stream. Constructs and returns a cipher for the encryption of the remaining parts of the file.

Parameters:
output - an open OutputStream to which the file is written
passphrase - the user encryption passphrase used for this file
Returns:
the PwsCipher with which the remainder of the file has to be encrypted
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs
java.lang.NullPointerException - on missing param

getWriteHmac

public PwsChecksum getWriteHmac()
Returns the HMAC checksum object to be used for writing the remainder of the file. (Available after save() operation was performed.)

Returns:
PwsChecksum

getReadHmac

public PwsChecksum getReadHmac()
Returns the HMAC checksum object to be used for reading the remainder of the file. (Available after verifyPass() operation was performed.)

Returns:
PwsChecksum

verifyPass

public PwsBlockInputStream verifyPass(PwsPassphrase passphrase)
                               throws java.io.IOException
Verifies whether the file trailing this header can be read with the passphrase submitted as parameter. In the positive case creates and returns the PwsBlockInputStream which is to be used for reading the decrypted remainder of the file. This method also prepares the file's header data fields (e.g. preferences, uuid, options, etc.) to become retrieveable through this header.

Parameters:
passphrase - PwsPassphrase a candidate file access key
Returns:
a PwsCipher value not null if and only if the file of this header is accessible (can be decrypted) with the specified passphrase
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if passphrase is undefined
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the header is not read from a file or already has been verified before
java.io.IOException

genRandHash

public static byte[] genRandHash(PwsPassphrase passphrase,
                                 byte[] random,
                                 int iterations)
Returns a cryptographic hash value for a random salt block and a passphrase. This follows a special procedure defined for PasswordSafe V3 files.

Returns:
cryptographic hash value on the parameters
